title: Google\Cloud\Compute\V1\Snapshot
name: Snapshot
description:
Represents a Persistent Disk Snapshot resource. You can use snapshots to back up data on a regular interval. For more information, read Creating persistent disk snapshots.

Generated from protobuf message google.cloud.compute.v1.Snapshot

Extends Google\Protobuf\Internal\Message

methods.name: __construct
methods.description: Constructor.

params.name: data
params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.architecture
params.description: [Output Only] The architecture of the snapshot. Valid values are ARM64 or X86_64. Check the Architecture enum for the list of possible values.

params.name: data.auto_created
params.description: [Output Only] Set to true if snapshots are automatically created by applying resource policy on the target disk.

params.name: data.chain_name
params.description: Creates the new snapshot in the snapshot chain labeled with the specified name. The chain name must be 1-63 characters long and comply with RFC1035. This is an uncommon option only for advanced service owners who needs to create separate snapshot chains, for example, for chargeback tracking. When you describe your snapshot resource, this field is visible only if it has a non-empty value.

params.name: data.creation_size_bytes
params.description: [Output Only] Size in bytes of the snapshot at creation time.

params.name: data.creation_timestamp
params.description: [Output Only] Creation timestamp in RFC3339 text format.

params.name: data.description
params.description: An optional description of this resource. Provide this property when you create the resource.

params.name: data.disk_size_gb
params.description: [Output Only] Size of the source disk, specified in GB.

params.name: data.download_bytes
params.description: [Output Only] Number of bytes downloaded to restore a snapshot to a disk.

params.name: data.id
params.description: [Output Only] The unique identifier for the resource. This identifier is defined by the server.

params.name: data.kind
params.description: [Output Only] Type of the resource. Always compute#snapshot for Snapshot resources.

params.name: data.label_fingerprint
params.description: A fingerprint for the labels being applied to this snapshot, which is essentially a hash of the labels set used for optimistic locking. The fingerprint is initially generated by Compute Engine and changes after every request to modify or update labels. You must always provide an up-to-date fingerprint hash in order to update or change labels, otherwise the request will fail with error 412 conditionNotMet. To see the latest fingerprint, make a get() request to retrieve a snapshot.

params.name: data.labels
params.description: Labels to apply to this snapshot. These can be later modified by the setLabels method. Label values may be empty.

params.name: data.license_codes
params.description: [Output Only] Integer license codes indicating which licenses are attached to this snapshot.

params.name: data.licenses
params.description: [Output Only] A list of public visible licenses that apply to this snapshot. This can be because the original image had licenses attached (such as a Windows image).

params.name: data.location_hint
params.description: An opaque location hint used to place the snapshot close to other resources. This field is for use by internal tools that use the public API.

params.name: data.name
params.description: Name of the resource; provided by the client when the resource is created. The name must be 1-63 characters long, and comply with RFC1035. Specifically, the name must be 1-63 characters long and match the regular expression [a-z]([-a-z0-9]*[a-z0-9])? which means the first character must be a lowercase letter, and all following characters must be a dash, lowercase letter, or digit, except the last character, which cannot be a dash.

params.name: data.satisfies_pzs
params.description: [Output Only] Reserved for future use.

params.name: data.self_link
params.description: [Output Only] Server-defined URL for the resource.

params.name: data.snapshot_encryption_key
params.description: Encrypts the snapshot using a customer-supplied encryption key. After you encrypt a snapshot using a customer-supplied key, you must provide the same key if you use the snapshot later. For example, you must provide the encryption key when you create a disk from the encrypted snapshot in a future request. Customer-supplied encryption keys do not protect access to metadata of the snapshot. If you do not provide an encryption key when creating the snapshot, then the snapshot will be encrypted using an automatically generated key and you do not need to provide a key to use the snapshot later.

params.name: data.snapshot_type
params.description: Indicates the type of the snapshot. Check the SnapshotType enum for the list of possible values.

params.name: data.source_disk
params.description: The source disk used to create this snapshot.

params.name: data.source_disk_encryption_key
params.description: The customer-supplied encryption key of the source disk. Required if the source disk is protected by a customer-supplied encryption key.

params.name: data.source_disk_id
params.description: [Output Only] The ID value of the disk used to create this snapshot. This value may be used to determine whether the snapshot was taken from the current or a previous instance of a given disk name.

params.name: data.source_snapshot_schedule_policy
params.description: [Output Only] URL of the resource policy which created this scheduled snapshot.

params.name: data.source_snapshot_schedule_policy_id
params.description: [Output Only] ID of the resource policy which created this scheduled snapshot.

params.name: data.status
params.description: [Output Only] The status of the snapshot. This can be CREATING, DELETING, FAILED, READY, or UPLOADING. Check the Status enum for the list of possible values.

params.name: data.storage_bytes
params.description: [Output Only] A size of the storage used by the snapshot. As snapshots share storage, this number is expected to change with snapshot creation/deletion.

params.name: data.storage_bytes_status
params.description: [Output Only] An indicator whether storageBytes is in a stable state or it is being adjusted as a result of shared storage reallocation. This status can either be UPDATING, meaning the size of the snapshot is being updated, or UP_TO_DATE, meaning the size of the snapshot is up-to-date. Check the StorageBytesStatus enum for the list of possible values.

params.name: data.storage_locations
params.description: Cloud Storage bucket storage location of the snapshot (regional or multi-regional).

methods.name: getLabelFingerprint
methods.description:
A fingerprint for the labels being applied to this snapshot, which is essentially a hash of the labels set used for optimistic locking. The fingerprint is initially generated by Compute Engine and changes after every request to modify or update labels. You must always provide an up-to-date fingerprint hash in order to update or change labels, otherwise the request will fail with error 412 conditionNotMet. To see the latest fingerprint, make a get() request to retrieve a snapshot.

Generated from protobuf field optional string label_fingerprint = 178124825;

methods.name: getSnapshotEncryptionKey
methods.description:
Encrypts the snapshot using a customer-supplied encryption key. After you encrypt a snapshot using a customer-supplied key, you must provide the same key if you use the snapshot later. For example, you must provide the encryption key when you create a disk from the encrypted snapshot in a future request. Customer-supplied encryption keys do not protect access to metadata of the snapshot. If you do not provide an encryption key when creating the snapshot, then the snapshot will be encrypted using an automatically generated key and you do not need to provide a key to use the snapshot later.

Generated from protobuf field optional .google.cloud.compute.v1.CustomerEncryptionKey snapshot_encryption_key = 43334526;
